occupation: Graduate Research Assistant at Carnegie Mellon University
headline: Graduate Student in Robotics/Computer Vision/ML @ CMU | Undergraduate in Computer Science Engineering @ IIIT-Hyderabad
summary:
Engineer and Researcher with a passion in Machine Learning, Computer Vision, and everything on the path towards AGI. Excited to work on interesting research problems, as well as, creating deploy-able real-world solutions.

Experience Areas : 
Computer Vision (Detection/Tracking, Segmentation, Streaming Perception, Few Shot Learning, Domain Adaptation, Multi-Spectral Vision, Generative AI, AR-VR)
Machine Learning (Deep Learning, Optimization)
Robotics (SLAM, Field Robotics, Embodied AI)

Website : https://anirudharamesh.github.io/

experiences.title: Graduate Research Assistant
experiences.description:
Work with Prof. Jeff Schneider, Prof. Christoph Mertz, and National Robotics Engineering Corporation (NREC) in :-

- Designing and deploying a first of a kind perception system capable of functioning 24/7, utilizing multi-spectral vision inputs across various modalities. Lead team for object detection and semantic segmentation, and collaborate with teams leading other components for general integration and system building.
- Transforming perception systems equipped to work in structured, well-lit environments to unstructured environments with variable lighting by developing novel algorithms for domain adaptation and generalization so as to create more adaptable robots and AI-systems.

experiences.title: Undergraduate Research Assistant
experiences.description:
Primarily worked on Monocular Visual SLAM in dynamic on-road scenes. Developed a novel solution to the intractable relative scale problem in Monocular SLAM, proposing both a vision as well as optimization based solution. 
Work accepted in IEEE Intelligent Vehicle Symposium - 2020, and VISIGRAPP (VISAPP), 2021.
Mentored new lab inductees on computer vision, deep learning systems, and optimization.
Additionally, worked on Probabilistic Collision Avoidance for Multiple Robots. Work accepted at IV-2021.

experiences.title: Research Intern
experiences.description:
Discovered and solved biases in existing solutions, and in the structuring of prominent datasets for Few Shot
Segmentation (FSS) Adobe MDSR team. Upon solving for these biases, we add to the performance of all tested underlying networks by âˆ¼ 5% mIoU. 
Published at NeurIPS 2021 along with a new dataset (TOSS) for nuanced evaluation of FSS.

education.school: International Institute of Information Technology Hyderabad (IIITH)
